intro: Heterozostera, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae. The plants typically grow in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Heterozostera species are perennial herbs with fibrous roots and upright, branching stems. Their leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, with some species displaying a waxy coating to reduce water loss.
